meaningMnemonic: This word consists of kanji with hiragana attached. Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>receive</kanji>, making this <vocabulary>to receive something</vocabulary>, or alternatively, <vocabulary>to get something from someone</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to be given something</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic: Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You learned that reading with the kanji, so you should be good to go here!
